definition: to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
Iron Chancellor, refers to Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, minister-president of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890

sentences.english: The old king reposed too little power in the young chancellor.
sentences.chinese: 年老的国王授予这位年轻宰相的权力太小了。

sentences.english: Later when the state of qi guanzhong ruler, and cao foam did lu general.
sentences.chinese: 后来管仲当了齐国的宰相，而曹沫做了鲁国的将军。

sentences.english: Joseph was 30 years old when the Pharaoh made him second in Charge.
sentences.chinese: 法老在约瑟30岁时立他作埃及的宰相。

sentences.english: Yehen been to the prime minister post after the strike and return to their homes.
sentences.chinese: 叶衡被罢工去宰相职位之后，回到家里。

sentences.english: The system of prime minister was a modulatory mechanism and necessary supplementation of the monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 宰相制度是君主制度的调节机制和必要补充。

sentences.english: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.chinese: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

sentences.english: At that time I had the rank of Prime Minister and I received my daily allotment of ten pods of peanuts.
sentences.chinese: 当时我是被封为宰相，每日都得他十荚的落花生吃。

sentences.english: The emperor was only a young ruler under the influence of the chief minister.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝只是一个年轻的领导人，他要受宰相的影响。

sentences.english: Yi Yin, the prime minister, had been a dowry slave of Tang's wife working in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 伊尹，宰相，曾是汤的妻子陪嫁奴隶，在厨房干活。

sentences.english: Wen Tianxiang was the prime minister of the Song Dynasty. He lost the battle against Yuan's army and was captured .
sentences.chinese: 文天祥是宋朝的宰相，在与元军的战斗中兵败被俘。

sentences.english: And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 告诉他说，约瑟还在，并且作埃及全地的宰相。

sentences.english: But why does this prime minister's gate face the north?
sentences.chinese: 可是为什么这宰相府的大门冲北面开呀？

sentences.english: In China, as early as the Sung Dynasty, when there are black prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 我们国家早在宋朝，就有黑人官居宰相。

sentences.english: Who was known as Iron chancellor?
Is the Dragon King of the prime minister ah.
sentences.chinese: 乌龟是谁？是海龙王的宰相啊。

sentences.english: Lu Mu Gong Mongolia are doing when the prime minister is always based on generous treat people, Taizong very appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 吕文穆公蒙正做宰相时总以宽厚待人，太宗非常赏识。

definition: the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
Minister of Revenue (from the Han dynasty onwards)
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
